oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trichomoniasis in Beef Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rodning, Soren P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Reproductive efficiency
cow-calf
Bovine trichomoniasis
protozoan
trichomoniasis
pathogenesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reproductive efficiency is one of the most important factors influencing the economic success of a cow-calf operation. Bovine trichomoniasis, also known as trichomonosis, is a venereal disease caused by the protozoan Tritrichomonas foetus that negatively impacts a herd's reproductive efficiency, thereby having a substantial economic impact on a cattle operation. This paper outlines the pathogenesis, prevalence, economic impact and diagnosis of trichomoniasis in cattle, as well as reviewing common guidelines for the prevention and control of trichomoniasis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007; 71-76
